Calendar + Syllabus

Week Date Class Topics Readings Work Due
1 Jan 8 Introduction and Course Overview
Jan 10 Class Cancelled
2 Jan 15 No Class / MLK Day
Jan 17 n-gram Language Models I Jurafsky and Martin, 3.1-3.3 HW1 Released
3 Jan 22 n-gram Language Models II Jurafsky and Martin, [Chap 3.4-3.7] Additional: Mitchell, Chap 2, Estimating Probabilities
Jan 24 Project Pitches
4 Jan 29 Logistic Regression Jurafsky and Martin, [Chap 5.1-5.2,5.4-5.5]
Jan 31 Logistic Regression II Jurafsky and Martin, [Chap 5.3, 5.6-5.8] HW1 Due
5 Feb 5 Word Embeddings I Jurafsky and Martin, [Chap 6.3-6.7]
Feb 7 Word Embeddings II Jurafsky and Martin, [Chap 6.8-6.13] Project Proposal Due; HW2 Released
6 Feb 12 Feedforward Neural Net Language Models Jurafsky and Martin, [Chap 7]
Feb 14 Recurrent Neural Net Language Models Jurafsky and Martin, [Chap 9]
7 Feb 19 No Class / President's Day
Feb 21 Sequence-to-Sequence and Attention Jurafsky and Martin, [Chap 9.7-9.8]
8 Feb 26 Transformers - Building Blocks Jurafsky and Martin, [Chap 10] HW2 Due
Feb 28 Project Discussions
9 Mar 4 Transformers - Building Blocks II Jurafsky and Martin, [Chap 10] Project Progress Report; HW3 Released
Mar 6 PyTorch Demo
10 Mar 11 Spring Break
Mar 13 Spring Break
11 Mar 18 Pretraining and Finetuning Transformers Jurafsky and Martin, [Chap 11.1-11.2]
Mar 20 Pretraining and Finetuning Transformers - Contd. Jurafsky and Martin, [Chap 11.3] HW3; HW4 Released
12 Mar 25 LLM Harms - Guest Lecture
Mar 27 Language Generation Jurafsky and Martin, [Chap 13.4]
13 Apr 1 Language Generation - Modern Sampling Jurafsky and Martin, [Chap 10.8]
Apr 3 Evaluating Generations + Prompting and Instruction Tuning Jurafsky and Martin, [Chap 13.6] HW4 Due
14 Apr 8 Project Discussions
Apr 10 Aligning LLMs
15 Apr 15 Advanced Topics + Putting it all together
Apr 17 Final Presentations I
16 Apr 22 Final Presentations II
Apr 24 Final Presentations III

Calendar and prespecified syllabus are subject to change. More details, e.g. reading materials and additional resources will be added as the semester continues. All work (except the project final report) is due on the specified date by 11:59 PM PT.

Assignments

There will be three components to course grades, see more details.

  • Homeworks (40%).
  • Quizzes + Class Participation (20%).
  • Class Project (40%).

Students are allowed a maximum of 6 late days total for all assignments (NO LATE DAYS ALLOWED FOR quizzes), with a maximum of 3 late days per deliverable.

Note: Please familiarize yourself with the academic policies and read the note about student well-being.
